Course Description: This course focuses on providing students an interactive discussion based learning platform for exploration of topics in adaptive cyber security. The learning will be through instruction, course project and more importantly through discussions on student(s) presentation of assigned research papers. The instruction part of the course will cover basic contents required to understand the course materials, including topics such as threat intelligence, situational awareness and real-time adaptive security. Through this course, students can learn the state of the art and open problems in adaptive cyber security, thus enhancing their potential to perform research or pursue a career in this emerging area.

Mandatory: CSE345/CSE545 Foundations of Computer Security (or) CSE350/CSE550 Network Security
Desirable: Students are also expected to have good understanding of basic concepts in machine learning

Course Outcomes.CO1: Define and Describe several topics in adaptive cybersecurity.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Deconstruct and Explain effectiveness and limitation of proposed solutions (from literature) for adaptive cybersecurity.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Critique and Conclude effectiveness and limitation of proposed solutions (from literature) for adaptive cybersecurity.
Course Outcomes.CO4: Designing and Developing specific solution(s) to an open problem in adaptive cybersecurity.
